com.pvsagar.smartlockscreen.applogic_objects

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pvsagar.smartlockscreen.applogic_objects.Environment

  • public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by aravind on 10/8/14. This class is used to store environment used in the app. It consists primarily of different environment variables, name, hint etc. Database helper functions and static functions to read environment details from the database, are also provided.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Environment

        public Environment()
        Default constructor. Sets the boolean values.

      • Environment

        public Environment(java.lang.String name,
           EnvironmentVariable... variables)
        Constructor which sets environment name and environment variables.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the environment
        variables - environment variables corresponding to the environment. Note that only bluetooth environment variables can be multiple in number for an environment, For other kinds of variables, the last variable of that type which was passed is taken

      • Environment

        public Environment(java.lang.String name,
           java.util.List<EnvironmentVariable> variables)
        Similar to previous constructor, but this accepts a List of environment variables.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the environment
        variables - environment variables corresponding to the environment. Note that only bluetooth environment variables can be multiple in number for an environment, For other kinds of variables, the last variable of that type which was passed is taken

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of the environment
        Parameters:
        name - Environment name

      • setBluetoothAllOrAny

        public void setBluetoothAllOrAny(boolean b)
        Sets whether the environment should check for all the bluetooth devices specified, or the environment is active when any of the specified bluetooth devices are connected.
        Parameters:
        b - true: all, false: any

      • addEnvironmentVariables

        public void addEnvironmentVariables(EnvironmentVariable... variables)
        Adds the passed environment variables to the environment. If an environment variable of type other than BluetoothEnvironmentVariable is passed, it'll reset the current value.
        Parameters:
        variables - variables to be added.

      • addLocationVariable

        public void addLocationVariable(LocationEnvironmentVariable variable)
        Sets the LocationEnvironmentVariable of the environment.
        Parameters:
        variable - new environment variable. pass null to indicate environment does not have a location associated with it

      • addBluetoothDevicesEnvironmentVariable

        public void addBluetoothDevicesEnvironmentVariable(BluetoothEnvironmentVariable variable)
        Adds BluetoothEnvironmentVariable to the environment.
        Parameters:
        variable - new environment variable. pass null to indicate environment does not have bluetoothDevices associated with it

      • addWiFiEnvironmentVariable

        public void addWiFiEnvironmentVariable(WiFiEnvironmentVariable variable)
        Sets the WifiEnvironmentVariable of the environment.
        Parameters:
        variable - new environment variable. pass null to indicate environment does not have a wifi network associated with it

      • addNoiseLevelEnvironmentVariable

        public void addNoiseLevelEnvironmentVariable(NoiseLevelEnvironmentVariable variable)
        Sets the NoiseLevelEnvironmentVariable of the environment.
        Parameters:
        variable - new environment variable. pass null to indicate environment does not have noise level associated with it

      • insertIntoDatabase

        public void insertIntoDatabase(android.content.Context context)
        Inserts the environment into the database
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context

      • updateInDatabase

        public void updateInDatabase(android.content.Context context,
                    java.lang.String oldName)
        Update the environment entry in database. Old name of the environment should be passed if name has changed. If oldName is null, current name of the environment is taken and used for finding the records to update. Note: this does not update the environment picture in db. To do that, use updateEnvironmentPicture()
        Parameters:
        context - activity/service context
        oldName - The name of the environment to be modified

      • setEnabledInDatabase

        public static void setEnabledInDatabase(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String environmentName,
                        boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled flag of any environment in the database
        Parameters:
        context - activity/service context
        environmentName - Name of the environment whose enabled flag should b changed
        enabled - The new enabled value

      • getAllEnvironmentNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllEnvironmentNames(android.content.Context context)
        Returns list of names of all the environment in the database. To get the full environment details, see getFullEnvironment()
        Parameters:
        context - activity/service context
        Returns:
        A list of strings of environment names

      • getAllEnvironmentBarebones

        public static java.util.List<Environment> getAllEnvironmentBarebones(android.content.Context context)
        Returns a list of Environment instances, without the environment variables populated, for all environments in the database. Useful for getting id, name, isEnabled, Hint and picture of all environments
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        Returns:
        List of barebone Environment instances (without the Environment Variables populated)

      • getFullEnvironment

        public static Environment getFullEnvironment(android.content.Context context,
                             java.lang.String environmentName)
        Get the complete environment details of an environment from the database
        Parameters:
        context - activity/service context
        environmentName - Name of the environment whose details are required
        Returns:
        An instance of Environment with the required details

      • getBareboneEnvironment

        public static Environment getBareboneEnvironment(android.content.Context context,
                                 java.lang.String environmentName)
        Returns an environment instance of the environment specified by its name. Only name, hint, id and enabled flag are populated. The environment variables are not populated
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        environmentName - Name of the environment whose details are required
        Returns:
        Instance of environment with specified fields populated.

      • getBareboneEnvironment

        public static Environment getBareboneEnvironment(android.content.Context context,
                                 long environmentId)
        Returns an environment instance of the environment specified by its id. Only name, hint, id and enabled flag are populated. The environment variables are not populated
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        environmentId - Id of the environment whose details are required
        Returns:
        Instance of environment with specified fields populated.

      • getAllEnvironmentBarebonesForLocation

        public static java.util.List<Environment> getAllEnvironmentBarebonesForLocation(android.content.Context context,
                                                                LocationEnvironmentVariable location)
        Gets all the environment barebones for given location
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        location - Environments having this location will be returned. id of the location should be populated
        Returns:
        List of Environments that match the criteria

      • getAllEnvironmentBarebonesWithoutLocation

        public static java.util.List<Environment> getAllEnvironmentBarebonesWithoutLocation(android.content.Context context)
        Gets barebone of all environments which do not have location associated with it
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        Returns:
        List of all environment (barebones) which does not have location

      • buildEnvironmentBareboneFromCursor

        private static Environment buildEnvironmentBareboneFromCursor(android.database.Cursor envCursor)
        Builds an Environment object from a cursor containing values from environments table. Only the barebone environment is build; the environment variables are not populated.
        Parameters:
        envCursor - cursor containing data from environments table
        Returns:
        Environment instance populated with data from the cursor

      • deleteEnvironmentFromDatabase

        public static void deleteEnvironmentFromDatabase(android.content.Context context,
                                 java.lang.String environmentName)
        Function to delete an environment from the database
        Parameters:
        context - Activity/ service context
        environmentName - Name of the environment to be deleted
